title: Workshops

Data Visualization with R Shiny
Conducted a workshop on building interactive dashboards with R Shiny to help participants visualize complex datasets.

title: Workshops
section: Create Interactive Apps with Shiny in R
text:
Create Interactive Apps with Shiny in R

Overview
Transform your data into engaging, interactive web applications using Shiny—a powerful R package for dynamic user interfaces. In this hands-on workshop, I guided participants through building and customizing Shiny apps, creating reactive visualizations with ggplot2 and plotly, and deploying the applications online. This session was designed for both beginners and R users looking to expand their technical skills.




Learning Outcomes

Understand the fundamental architecture of Shiny apps (using ui.R/server.R or app.R structures).

Implement reactive programming to build dynamic, responsive applications.

Create and customize interactive data visualizations with ggplot2 and plotly.

Deploy Shiny apps on platforms such as shinyapps.io and shinylive.

Learn best practices for securing Shiny applications, including authentication.




Key Skills Gained

Shiny app development

Reactive programming in R

Interactive data visualization

Web application deployment

Application security practices

title: Workshops
text:
Text Mining in R

Overview
This workshop offered a practical demonstration of text mining using real-world Twitter data. Participants learned to access the Twitter API, clean and tokenize text, analyze sentiment, and mine topics from tweets. The session emphasized transforming unstructured text into meaningful insights.




Learning Outcomes

Clean, tidy, and tokenize textual data for analysis.

Apply TF-IDF to assess word importance.

Conduct sentiment analysis to interpret social media data.

Use topic modeling techniques to identify themes within text.




Key Skills Gained

Text data preprocessing

Sentiment analysis

TF-IDF analysis

Topic modeling techniques

title: Workshops
section: R Workshop Series #6: Data Visualization with R
text:
R Workshop Series #6: Data Visualization with R

Overview
This advanced workshop focused on creating publication-quality data visualizations using R. We explored various chart types—from simple graphs to sophisticated layered visuals—leveraging R’s built-in functions along with packages like ggplot2 and lattice. The session helped participants select the best visualization techniques for different data scenarios.




Learning Outcomes

Identify and compare popular R visualization packages.

Understand the grammar of graphics using ggplot2.

Create charts for univariate and bivariate data.

Layer and customize visualizations to convey data insights effectively.

Filter and manipulate data with tidyverse functions.




Key Skills Gained

Advanced data visualization techniques

Mastery of ggplot2 and lattice

Layered chart creation

Data manipulation with tidyverse

Visual storytelling

title: Workshops
text:
R Workshop Series #5: R Programming

Overview
In this session, I introduced the principles of good coding practice in R. Participants learned about logical operators, control structures (if-statements and loops), custom function creation, and the efficient use of apply family functions. This workshop laid a solid foundation for writing clean, efficient R code.




Learning Outcomes

Practice good coding standards and techniques.

Use logical operators and control structures effectively.

Create custom R functions.

Simplify repetitive tasks using apply functions.

Familiarize with essential built-in R functions.




Key Skills Gained

Fundamental R programming

Logical and control structures

Custom function development

Code optimization

Efficient use of apply functions

title: Workshops
section: R Workshop Series #4: Data Manipulation with Tidyverse
text:
R Workshop Series #4: Data Manipulation with Tidyverse

Overview
This workshop focused on the essentials of data manipulation using the Tidyverse. I demonstrated how to transform raw data into tidy, analysis-ready formats using key dplyr verbs and the piping operator. The session emphasized practical data wrangling techniques to streamline analysis workflows.




Learning Outcomes

Understand the concept of data wrangling and tidy data.

Differentiate between tibbles and traditional data frames.

Convert data between wide and long formats.

Apply key dplyr verbs for data transformation.

Utilize the piping operator to build efficient data pipelines.




Key Skills Gained

Data wrangling with Tidyverse

Tidy data conversion

Mastery of dplyr verbs

Efficient data transformation

Pipeline construction

title: Workshops
section: R Workshop Series #3: Data Input and Output
text:
R Workshop Series #3: Data Input and Output

Overview
This workshop covers the fundamentals of data input and output in R. I explained how to work with built-in datasets, import data from various file formats, scrape data from the web, and export processed data. The session also highlighted the importance of version control with Git and GitHub.




Learning Outcomes

Efficiently use built-in R datasets.

Import data from CSV, XLSX, and SPSS files.

Scrape web data using SelectorGadget and rvest.

Export and save data in different formats.

Understand the basics of version control with Git and GitHub.




Key Skills Gained

Data import/export techniques

Web data scraping

File handling in R

Version control with Git/GitHub

Practical data I/O operations

title: Workshops
section: R Workshop Series #2: R Data Types
text:
R Workshop Series #2: R Data Types

Overview
This introductory workshop covered the core data types and structures in R. Participants learned about atomic data types (numeric, character, logical) as well as more complex structures such as vectors, matrices, data frames, and lists. This session laid the groundwork for effective data manipulation in R.




Learning Outcomes

Define and differentiate between atomic data types in R.

Understand the use cases for vectors, matrices, data frames, and lists.

Learn when and how to use each data type effectively.

Create and manipulate data frames using R.

Perform basic operations to view and transform data.




Key Skills Gained

Understanding of R data types

Data structure manipulation

Creation and management of data frames

Fundamental data operations

Foundational R programming knowledge

title: Workshops
section: R Workshop Series #1: Introduction to R
text:
R Workshop Series #1: Introduction to R

Overview
This beginner-friendly workshop introduced the basics of R and RStudio. Participants learned how to install R and RStudio, navigate the interface, create and run scripts, download packages, and document projects using R Markdown. The session provided essential tips for new users to become comfortable with R.




Learning Outcomes

Navigate the R and RStudio interface confidently.

Install R, RStudio, and essential R packages.

Create, run, and save R scripts.

Use R Markdown to document projects effectively.

Leverage online resources and the R community for continuous learning.




Key Skills Gained

R installation and setup

RStudio navigation

Script writing and execution

R Markdown documentation

Effective use of R community resources

title: Hi, I’m Jarrod Griffin
text:
Featured Projects

The Chubb Archive
A digital hub for preserving and sharing cherished family memories, The Chubb Archive curates old physical films that have been digitized and hosted on YouTube. I built thechubbarchive.com as an organized gateway to these films, integrating Google Analytics to track and confirm engagement from family members across various states.


A Safer Way to Collect Data: Market Area Mapping
In my role as an Analyst, I revolutionized the process of defining military installation market areas. Previously, data was manually recorded—a time-consuming and hazardous method. I developed a Shiny R app that integrates with Strava to automatically capture GPS data during field drives. By leveraging the sf and leaflet packages along with the HERE API, the app produces an interactive map that improves both the accuracy and safety of data collection.


Motivation Through a Dashboard
Tasked with organizing and categorizing flagged data from a large, complex database, I noticed that team morale was suffering due to the overwhelming volume of work. To address this, I created a straightforward yet effective dashboard that displays key metrics and a visual history of the team’s progress. This tool not only streamlined data processing but also boosted team motivation by clearly showcasing achievements over time.
Explore Projects

title: Hi, I’m [Your Name Here]
text:
Let’s Connect
I’m always excited to meet others and explore new ideas. You can email me or connect on LinkedIn.

Welcome to my portfolio—where creativity meets data and ideas come to life.

title: Hi, I’m Jarrod Griffin
text:
Reproducible Research & Quarto
I am a strong advocate for reproducible research, and I harness modern tools like Quarto to create dynamic, transparent documents and websites. By integrating code, narrative, and visualizations, Quarto empowers me to develop work that is easily updated, shared, and verified. This approach not only enhances the integrity of my research but also makes it accessible to collaborators and the broader community.

title: Featured Projects
text:
The Chubb Archive
I created thechubbarchive.com as a digital hub for preserving and sharing cherished family memories. This project curates a collection of old physical films that have been digitized and hosted on YouTube. The platform serves as an organized gateway to these films while integrating Google Analytics to track engagement from family members across various states.
Skills Developed:

Web Development: Building a responsive website for digital archiving.
Digital Curation: Organizing and presenting multimedia content.
Analytics Integration: Implementing Google Analytics to monitor user engagement.
Project Management: Coordinating digitization and online publishing processes.

title: Featured Projects
section: A Safer Way to Collect Data: Market Area Mapping
text:
A Safer Way to Collect Data: Market Area Mapping
In my role as an Analyst, I was responsible for determining the “market area” of military installations—a process that previously involved manual note-taking at major intersections. To overcome the challenges of inaccuracy and safety risks, I developed a Shiny R application that integrates with the Strava API to automatically capture GPS data during field drives. Using the sf and leaflet packages, the app generates an interactive map of our routes, significantly enhancing both safety and data accuracy. Additionally, the HERE API is utilized to estimate market areas, adding an extra layer of verification.
Skills Developed:

Advanced R Programming: Building interactive applications with Shiny.
API Integration: Working with Strava and HERE APIs to automate data collection.
Geospatial Analysis: Using sf and leaflet for mapping and spatial data visualization.
Process Optimization: Streamlining data collection methods for improved safety and efficiency.

title: Featured Projects
text:
Motivation Through a Dashboard
While managing a large, complex database of flagged data, I observed that the team’s motivation was waning due to the overwhelming volume and slow progress. To address this, I quickly created a simple yet effective dashboard that visualizes key metrics and tracks the team’s progress over time. The dashboard provided clear insights into accomplishments, significantly boosting team morale and focus on the end goal.
Skills Developed:

Data Visualization: Designing dashboards that effectively communicate progress.
User Experience (UX): Crafting visual tools that motivate and engage team members.
Performance Metrics Analysis: Identifying and presenting key performance indicators.
Dashboard Development: Integrating dynamic data displays within existing applications.

title: Featured Projects
section: Analyzing SEO Practices: TRI and Industry Competitors
text:
Analyzing SEO Practices: TRI and Industry Competitors
In this project, I conducted a comprehensive analysis of SEO practices for Trauma Resource Institute(TRI) and compared them with industry competitors. By combining web scraping, keyword research, and data visualization, I identified strengths and weaknesses in TRI’s online presence and developed actionable recommendations for improving digital strategy.
Skills Developed:

SEO Analysis: Evaluated and benchmarked SEO performance across multiple competitors.
Data Scraping & Cleaning: Wrote a script to collect and process data from various online sources.
Interactive Reporting: Created an interactive HTML report to visualize comparative SEO metrics.
Strategic Insights: Synthesized data into actionable recommendations for digital marketing initiatives.

Below is an embedded demonstration of the interactive report:

title: Marketing Analytics
text:
Below are selected projects that highlight my experience applying marketing analytics to real-world challenges. These projects reflect my ability to combine statistical tools, campaign data, and strategic thinking to inform decisions and drive results.
Whether developing dashboards, analyzing campaign performance, or uncovering insights through SEO and web analytics, each project is rooted in turning complex marketing data into clear, actionable strategies.

title: Marketing Analytics
section: A Safer Way to Collect Data: Market Area Mapping
text:
A Safer Way to Collect Data: Market Area Mapping
In my role as an Analyst, I was responsible for determining the “market area” of military installations—a process that previously involved manual note-taking at major intersections. To overcome the challenges of inaccuracy and safety risks, I developed a Shiny R application that integrates with the Strava API to automatically capture GPS data during field drives. Using the sf and leaflet packages, the app generates an interactive map of our routes, significantly enhancing both safety and data accuracy. Additionally, the HERE API is utilized to estimate market areas, adding an extra layer of verification.
Skills Developed:

Advanced R Programming: Building interactive applications with Shiny.
API Integration: Working with Strava and HERE APIs to automate data collection.
Geospatial Analysis: Using sf and leaflet for mapping and spatial data visualization.
Process Optimization: Streamlining data collection methods for improved safety and efficiency.

title: Marketing Analytics
section: Analyzing SEO Practices: TRI and Industry Competitors
text:
Analyzing SEO Practices: TRI and Industry Competitors
In this project, I conducted a comprehensive analysis of SEO practices for Trauma Resource Institute(TRI) and compared them with industry competitors. By combining web scraping, keyword research, and data visualization, I identified strengths and weaknesses in TRI’s online presence and developed actionable recommendations for improving digital strategy.
Skills Developed:

SEO Analysis: Evaluated and benchmarked SEO performance across multiple competitors.
Data Scraping & Cleaning: Wrote a script to collect and process data from various online sources.
Interactive Reporting: Created an interactive HTML report to visualize comparative SEO metrics.
Strategic Insights: Synthesized data into actionable recommendations for digital marketing initiatives.

title: Strategic Marketing
text: Below are selected projects that showcase my work in strategic marketing, campaign development, and brand management. These examples highlight how I apply leadership, data-informed decision making, and creative direction to drive marketing success.

title: Strategic Marketing
text:
[Project Title 1: Strategic Campaign Planning]
In this project, I led the development of a comprehensive marketing campaign for [product, service, or initiative]. From audience segmentation to messaging strategy, I managed the full lifecycle of the campaign, aligning it with business objectives and measurable KPIs.
Skills Demonstrated:

Marketing Strategy: Defined objectives and tactics for maximum impact.
Team Coordination: Oversaw collaboration across creative, data, and channel teams.
Performance Tracking: Implemented real-time metrics and post-campaign analysis.
Brand Positioning: Ensured consistency across all touchpoints.

title: Strategic Marketing
text:
[Project Title 2: Brand Audit & Positioning]
This initiative involved conducting a full brand audit for [organization or brand], evaluating its current market perception, competitive landscape, and customer engagement. I synthesized insights into a refreshed brand strategy and visual identity recommendations.
Skills Demonstrated:

Brand Analysis: Audited messaging, tone, and visual identity.
Competitive Benchmarking: Evaluated brand positioning within the market.
Strategic Communication: Developed new value propositions and storytelling elements.
Stakeholder Presentation: Delivered recommendations to senior leadership.

title: Strategic Marketing
text:
[Project Title 3: Product Launch Go-to-Market Plan]
For the release of [new product/service], I created a go-to-market (GTM) strategy from scratch. This included customer journey mapping, channel mix planning, and launch timeline coordination.
Skills Demonstrated:

Go-to-Market Strategy: Developed a clear launch roadmap aligned with buyer needs.
Integrated Marketing: Orchestrated email, paid ads, social, and on-site promotions.
Budget Management: Allocated resources efficiently across tactics.
Launch Optimization: Tracked performance and refined tactics in real time.

text:
[Project Title 4: Client Consulting & Campaign Optimization]
I collaborated with a client to assess and optimize their existing marketing efforts. Through audits, persona development, and campaign refinement, I helped improve ROI and audience engagement.

title: Marketing Analytics
text:
What You’ll Find

Campaign Performance Analysis: Evaluating the effectiveness of digital marketing efforts using data.
Data Visualization: Turning raw datasets into intuitive dashboards and reports.
Marketing Mix & Attribution: Exploring how different channels contribute to success.
Customer & Market Insights: Using analytics to better understand user behavior and optimize experiences.

title: Campaign Insights Dashboard
text:
Overview
This project involved building a dashboard to track and visualize marketing campaign performance. Metrics like click-through rate, conversion rate, and ROI were tracked across channels using R and Tableau.




Learning Outcomes

Visualize and monitor key marketing metrics.

Analyze performance trends across multiple campaigns.

Identify high- and low-performing segments.

Communicate insights through interactive visuals.

Develop data-informed recommendations.




Key Skills Gained

Dashboard development

Campaign analytics

Data wrangling in R

Tableau or R Shiny visualization

Performance measurement

title: SEO Benchmarking Analysis
text:
Overview
This project compared SEO performance across competitors, highlighting keyword gaps, backlink profiles, and content effectiveness. Insights were used to guide an improved content and SEO strategy.




Learning Outcomes

Identify keyword opportunities through competitive research.

Track and compare domain authority and page rankings.

Recommend on-page SEO improvements.

Design a data-driven SEO content strategy.

Visualize competitor positioning.




Key Skills Gained

Keyword research

Web scraping & data cleaning

SEO analysis tools

Data storytelling

Strategy development

title: Customer Segmentation Using Clustering
text:
Overview
In this analysis, customer data was segmented using clustering algorithms to identify meaningful groups. These segments informed targeting strategies and personalization efforts.




Learning Outcomes

Clean and prepare customer-level data.

Apply clustering techniques to group similar customers.

Interpret clusters to define marketing personas.

Recommend tailored messaging strategies.

Support targeted campaign development.




Key Skills Gained

K-means clustering

Data preprocessing

Customer profiling

Market segmentation strategy

R or Python for machine learning

title: Marketing Funnel Attribution Model
text:
Overview
This project developed a marketing attribution model to assign credit to touchpoints throughout the conversion journey. The insights supported channel optimization and budget reallocation.




Learning Outcomes

Track multi-touch customer journeys.

Model attribution using first-touch, last-touch, and linear approaches.

Visualize funnel performance.

Quantify channel impact on conversion.

Guide future campaign investment decisions.




Key Skills Gained

Attribution modeling

Funnel analysis

Data visualization

Campaign performance analysis

R or Python analytics pipelines

title: Social Media Engagement Analysis
text:
Overview
This analysis examined engagement metrics across multiple social media platforms to identify content trends, audience preferences, and posting strategies that drive performance.




Learning Outcomes

Aggregate and clean social media data.

Identify high-performing content formats.

Understand audience behavior and peak times.

Support social strategy with data-backed recommendations.

Visualize results in an executive summary.




Key Skills Gained

Social analytics

Platform metric APIs

Content performance tracking

Audience insights

Strategic planning

title: Strategic Marketing
text:
